namespace.name: hibernate
namespace.usage-description: Tags for declaration of Hibernate descriptor file
namespace.condition-description: All classes, at class level and on getter methods

parameter.name: table
parameter.usage-description: The name of its database table

parameter.name: discriminator-value
parameter.usage-description: A value that distinguishes the particular subclass

parameter.name: mutable
parameter.usage-description: Specifies that instances of the class are (not) mutable

parameter.name: dynamic-update
parameter.usage-description: Specifies that only changed columns should appear in the SQL UPDATE

parameter.name: dynamic-insert
parameter.usage-description: Specifies that null columns should not appear in the SQL INSERT

parameter.name: polymorphism
parameter.usage-description: Enable "explicit" polymorphism

parameter.name: schema
parameter.usage-description: Override the schema name specified by the root hibernate-mapping element

parameter.name: proxy
parameter.usage-description: Specifies an interface to use for CGLIB proxies

tag.name: hibernate.subclass
tag.usage-description: Declare the current class as subclass

parameter.name: discriminator-value
parameter.usage-description: A value that distinguishes the particular subclass

parameter.name: proxy
parameter.usage-description: Specifies an interface to use for CGLIB proxies

parameter.name: dynamic-update
parameter.usage-description: Specifies that only changed columns should appear in the SQL UPDATE

parameter.name: dynamic-insert
parameter.usage-description: Specifies that null columns should not appear in the SQL INSERT

parameter.name: column
parameter.usage-description: The name of the mapped database table column

parameter.name: type
parameter.usage-description: The Hibernate type

parameter.name: length

tag.name: hibernate.joined-subclass

parameter.name: schema
parameter.usage-description: Override the schema name specified by the root hibernate-mapping element

parameter.name: usage
parameter.usage-description: Defines the cache semantics

parameter.name: usage
parameter.usage-description: Defines the cache semantics. nonstrict-read-write only applies to version 2.0 and later.

tag.name: hibernate.query
tag.usage-description: Declare a named query for class

parameter.usage-description: Name of this query

parameter.usage-description: Query contents

parameter.name: column

parameter.name: type
parameter.usage-description: The Hibernate type

parameter.name: length
parameter.usage-description: The length of the mapped database table column

parameter.name: unsaved-value
parameter.usage-description: A value that distinguishes transient instances with existing persistent state from new transient instances

parameter.name: generator-class
parameter.usage-description: The key generator class

tag.name: hibernate.generator-param
tag.usage-description: Specifies an id generator parameter value

parameter.name: name
parameter.usage-description: The name of the parameter

parameter.name: value
parameter.usage-description: The parameter value

parameter.name: column
parameter.usage-description: The name of the mapped database table column

parameter.name: type
parameter.usage-description: The Hibernate type

parameter.name: length
parameter.usage-description: The length of the mapped database table column

parameter.name: not-null
parameter.usage-description: If the column is not nullable

parameter.name: unique
parameter.usage-description: If the column is unique

parameter.name: insert
parameter.usage-description: Should the column appear in the SQL INSERT

parameter.name: update
parameter.usage-description: Should the column appear in the SQL UPDATE

parameter.name: class
parameter.usage-description: A fully qualified class name

parameter.name: prefix
parameter.usage-description: When multiple Java fields are of the same component datatype, use this to specify a descriminating column-name-prefix

parameter.name: column
parameter.usage-description: The name of a column holding the version number

parameter.name: type
parameter.usage-description: The Hibernate type

parameter.name: access
parameter.usage-description: The strategy Hibernate should use for accessing the property value.

parameter.name: unsaved-value
parameter.usage-description: A version property value that indicates that an instance is newly instantiated (unsaved), distinguishing it from transient instances that were saved or loaded in a previous session (undefined specifies that the identifier property value should be used).

parameter.name: column
parameter.usage-description: The name of an column holding the timestamp

parameter.name: column
parameter.usage-description: The name of the mapped database table column

parameter.name: class
parameter.usage-description: The name of the associated class

parameter.name: cascade
parameter.usage-description: Specifies which operations should be cascaded from the parent object to the associated object

parameter.name: not-null
parameter.usage-description: If the column is not nullable

parameter.name: unique
parameter.usage-description: If the column is unique

parameter.name: outer-join
parameter.usage-description: Enable outer-join fetching

parameter.name: insert
parameter.usage-description: Should the column appear in the SQL INSERT

parameter.name: update
parameter.usage-description: Should the column appear in the SQL UPDATE

parameter.name: property-ref
parameter.usage-description: The name of a property of the associated class that is joined to this foreign key. If not specified, the primary key of the associated class is used.

parameter.name: foreign-key
parameter.usage-description: The name of the foreign key constraint to associate with this association.

parameter.name: class
parameter.usage-description: The name of the associated class

parameter.name: property-ref
parameter.usage-description: bi-directional reference to one-to-one table that holds the foreign key

parameter.name: constrained
parameter.usage-description: Is there a foreign key constraint

parameter.name: cascade
parameter.usage-description: Specifies which operations should be cascaded from the parent object to the associated object

parameter.name: outer-join
parameter.usage-description: Enable outer-join fetching for this association when hibernate.use_outer_join is set

parameter.name: foreign-key
parameter.usage-description: The name of the foreign key constraint to associate with this association.

parameter.usage-description: The column name

parameter.name: lazy

parameter.usage-description: Specifies which operations should be cascaded from the parent object to the associated object
